item.title: By: Ben Rose
item.dc:creator: Ben Rose
item.description: <p>I've never been to Lotusphere and I'm not registered this year...<br/><br/><br/><br/>It's not coming from Lotusphere registrations at all.</p>
item.content:encoded:
I’ve never been to Lotusphere and I’m not registered this year…

It’s not coming from Lotusphere registrations at all.

item.title: By: Ben Poole
item.dc:creator: Ben Poole
item.description: <p>The only Lotusphere I've ever been to was in Berlin in 2000. Yet all of a sudden, this year, <b>the year I'm attending LS "proper", </b>I start getting LS-related spam.</p><p>Hmmm...!</p>
item.content:encoded:
The only Lotusphere I’ve ever been to was in Berlin in 2000. Yet all of a sudden, this year, the year I’m attending LS “proper”, I start getting LS-related spam.

Hmmm…!

item.title: By: Neil Agate
item.dc:creator: Neil Agate
item.description: <p>Mathew,<br/><br/><br/><br/>I noticed the same thig and called a couple of them on it and both said that they had got my email in past years at Lotusphere when I swiped my badge at their booths. Not sure if this is 100% true but I did realize that I used a personal email address to register for LS this year and to date it has not got any LS SPAM. Still aggrevating but I guess maybe a little less so.<br/><br/><br/><br/>Neil.</p>
item.content:encoded:
Mathew,

I noticed the same thig and called a couple of them on it and both said that they had got my email in past years at Lotusphere when I swiped my badge at their booths. Not sure if this is 100% true but I did realize that I used a personal email address to register for LS this year and to date it has not got any LS SPAM. Still aggrevating but I guess maybe a little less so.

Neil.
